intro: Macroglena setacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its fibrous roots and robust growth make it a common weed in agricultural areas.
